temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.content: Salmonella can grow at a temperature between 5°C and 47°C, although their optimal range is 35-37°C. Even if they cannot grow over 47°C, they can survive at higher temperature, until 70°C.

oxygen.title: Oxygen
oxygen.content: Salmonella are facultative anaerobe organisms, meaning that they use oxygen, but if it is not present, they are capable of fermenting.

ph.title: pH
ph.content: Salmonella cannot survive below pH of 4.0 and above pH 9.0 and can grow optimally at pH 6.5–7.5.

humidity.title: Water
humidity.content: Salmonella can grow with a water activity (aw) > 0.94, with an optimum around 0.99; it can survive in low-aw foods for years.

salinity.title: Salinity
salinity.content: Salmonella has a high tolerance to salt, so it seems that reducing of Aw is one of the most efficient method to prevent survival and growth of Salmonella in foods.
